body:
Hmm...  It is just an option to use exp as base rather than power.  But it
does make the naming a little confusing.  Do you have suggestions?  Thanks.

> I guess I don't see how exponential_decay is different:

> shows the same type of pattern -- let me know if I'm missing something
> subtle!

body_html:
Hmm... It is just an option to use exp as base rather than power. But it
does make the naming a little confusing. Do you have suggestions? Thanks.

On Mon, Mar 28, 2016, 1:01 PM Vijay Vasudevan notifications@github.com
wrote:

In tensorflow/python/training/initial_learning_rate_decay.py
#1512 (comment):

@@ -0,0 +1,190 @@
+# Copyright 2015 Google Inc. All Rights Reserved.

I guess I don't see how exponential_decay is different:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/training/learning_rate_decay.py#L51
shows the same type of pattern -- let me know if I'm missing something
subtle!

Hmm...  It is just an option to use exp as base rather than power.  But it
does make the naming a little confusing.  Do you have suggestions?  Thanks.
